physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Echocardiography revealed limited mobility of mitral valve leaflets in a four-chamber view, all chordae inserted into the posteromedial PM. Short-axis view detected the posteromedial PM but not the anterolateral PM. Additionally, a systematic scan showed coarctation of the aorta (CoA) and a small left ventricle.

Autopsy revealed all chordae connected to elongated posteromedial PM with narrowing of interchordal spaces and decreased diameter at mitral valve opening. The anterolateral PM was attached to the ventricular wall for its entire length with its tip near the mitral valve annulus. CoA was confirmed.
